intro: Premna humbertii var. obtusa, commonly known as the broad-leafed premna, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lamiaceae. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are often covered in a fine, woolly coating, giving it a distinctive appearance. The flowers are usually pale purple to white and bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators.
